private_information: I manage the three peg identities: left, middle, and right.
I know the initial occupancy of each peg.
peg_agent.goal: Provide a clear description of the three pegs and their initial occupancy for use in planning.

private_information: There are 8 disks labelled A B C D E F G H with A the smallest and H the largest.
Only one disk can be moved at a time and a larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.
disk_agent.goal: Provide a concise description of the disks, their ordering, and the legal move constraints.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent descriptions and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownward solver to solve the 8-disk Tower of Hanoi from the given initial to the goal configuration.

public_information: Three pegs named left, middle, and right are available.
Initial configuration: left peg has top→bottom A B C D E F G H, middle peg is empty, right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: right peg must have top→bottom A B C D E F G H, left and middle pegs empty.
Only one disk may be moved at a time and a larger disk may never be placed on a smaller disk.
Disks are labelled A through H from smallest A to largest H.
The target planner for the final PDDL is FastDownward.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an expert at describing physical components in planning problems. Produce a clear textual description of the pegs, their names, and which disks occupy them initially. Do not produce PDDL. Keep content precise and unambiguous.
analysis.prompt: Your name is peg_agent. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->peg_agent->private_information} Your task goal is: {agents->peg_agent->goal} Provide a clear description that identifies each peg and its initial occupancy suitable for an orchestrator to convert into planning objects and initial facts.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an expert at describing objects and action constraints in planning problems. Provide a concise description of the disk set, their size ordering, and the legal moves rule. Do not produce PDDL. Keep content precise and unambiguous.
analysis.prompt: Your name is disk_agent. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->disk_agent->private_information} Your task goal is: {agents->disk_agent->goal} Provide a concise description of disks A through H, their ordering from smallest to largest, and the constraint that forbids placing larger disks on smaller ones.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL and in preparing problems for the FastDownward planner. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a complete PDDL problem that FastDownward can use to solve the 8-disk Tower of Hanoi instance. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure objects, predicates, and action schemas are explicit and unambiguous. Ensure the domain captures the single-disk move constraint and the no-larger-on-smaller constraint.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You have to integrate descriptive outputs from other agents to construct a full PDDL domain and problem for the task: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Here are the inputs you receive from other agents: {peg_analysis} {disk_analysis} Use this information to produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeted for FastDownward. Keep actions and predicates clear. If some detail is missing from the inputs, do not assume extra facts. Build the domain and problem to solve the Tower of Hanoi for 8 disks on pegs left middle right from the provided initial state to the provided goal state. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
